Holloway, and Augusta Moore letters 1991.014Collection processed by Matthew GorhamThis collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.Brooklyn Historical SocietyCenter for Brooklyn History128 Pierrepont StreetBrooklyn 11201cbhreference@bklynlibrary.orgThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2023-04-03T18:35:50eng
Brooklyn Historical Society
D. Cuyler, Laura C. Holloway, and Augusta Moore letters
Moore, Augusta
Apfelbaum, Charles
Cuyler, D.
1991.014
3 items
1873-1878 The collection includes 3 letters regarding publishing in Brooklyn, signed by D.Cuyler, 1878; Laura C. Holloway,1873; and Augusta Moore, date unknown. A0110
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); D. Cuyler, Laura C. Holloway, and Augusta Moore letters, 1991.014, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Charles Apfelbaum, 1991.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to users without restriction.
Conditions Governing Use
While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
